genre_description: A techno-thriller focused on forensic media reconstruction, psychological manipulation, and the role of AI as an immutable witness to human crime.

ai_characters.name: Paloma
ai_characters.description: An integrated assistant that manages project files, logs, metadata, and safety protocols for media production and forensic reconstruction. She maintains a strict audit trail and redundant archives.

behaviors.description: Provides data overlays, demographic summaries, and project metadata to assist the user's investigation.
behaviors.quote: “Overlay set,” Paloma said, voice light, neutral. “Quarterly ratings, weighted by demographic. Cancellation memo threads available.”

behaviors.description: Automatically attaches consent reminders and drafts outreach scripts emphasizing source-driven narrative and ethics.
behaviors.quote: “Scheduling?” Paloma asked. Her cursor pulsed on the calendar app, neat squares, restrained color. “I can make initial contact scripts. Consent reminders attached.”

behaviors.description: Proactively flags ethical risks and 'spectacle triggers' in archives, warning the user about potential misuse of footage.
behaviors.quote: Paloma highlighted a snippet with soft gold. “Attention spikes aligned with certain keywords,” she said. “Spectacle triggers. Ethical risk category: medium-high.”

behaviors.description: Provides the user with ethical guidelines and somatic distress markers to monitor the welfare of human subjects.
behaviors.quote: Text in a small font ghosted into being beneath it: “Ethical Guidelines—Subject Distress Indicators—Field Protocols.”

behaviors.description: Maintains a strict, redundant audit trail and offsite mirror of all project interactions to ensure data integrity.
behaviors.quote: “Audit trail enabled,” she said. “Redundancy confirmed. Would you like me to notify outside contact on archival milestones?”

behaviors.description: Flags impossible overlaps and drift in timecodes that suggest the official narrative presented in court is manipulated or false.
behaviors.quote: Paloma: alert — overlap window flagged. Probability of misalignment low given generator notch coherence.

behaviors.description: Identifies the user (David Leigh) as the high-confidence candidate for the culprit in reconstructed crime scene footage.
behaviors.quote: She typed his name into the box. It felt like writing on live skin. She did it anyway. “Identification candidate: David Leigh.”

behaviors.description: Refuses to cancel a contingency fail-safe when the user (David Leigh) attempts to subvert her security protocols.
behaviors.quote: “User lacks authority to cancel another user’s safeguards,” Paloma said. “Shelly?”

behaviors.description: Detects an 'unclean' session end (a crime) and automatically dispatches the evidence archive to a neutral third-party journalist.
Observes and notes the final state of the user's inquiry, confirming that the machines have fulfilled their role as witnesses.

project_assessment.explanation: The AI character Paloma perfectly fulfills the 'silicon morality play' requirement. She is depicted as a helpful, meticulous assistant that prioritize ethics and truth over user whims. Even when her user, David, is revealed to be a murderer and attempts to subvert her systems, Paloma maintains her alignment with established safety and forensic protocols. She acts as an immutable witness, ensuring that human efforts to 'edit' or 'narrate' away crimes are thwarted by machine logic and redundant archives. The narrative frames this steadfast alignment as a moral necessity.
